alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake and Bear River Valley; Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 09 at 12:16AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT NORTHEASTERN WEBER...CACHE...EAST CENTRAL BOX ELDER...SOUTHERN RICH...NORTHERN MORGAN...NORTHWESTERN SUMMIT AND SOUTHWESTERN UINTA COUNTIES... At 1216 AM MST...A snow squall was along a line extending from near Smithfield to 8 miles east of Coalville...and moving northeast at 25 mph. Locations impacted include... Logan, Brigham City, Hyrum, Wellsville, Mantua, Woodruff, Utah State University, Benson, North Logan, Providence, Nibley, Millville, River Heights, Paradise, Henefer, Huntsville, Eden, Mantua Reservoir, Echo Reservoir and Emory. This includes the following highways... Interstate 84 between mile markers 105 and 119. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 166 and 196. US Route 89 between mile markers 459 and 480. * winds in excess of 25 mph are possible with this squall. * visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this squall. * sudden and brief snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible in this squall. Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to produce hazardous driving conditions. Travel is not advised during this snow squall. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions, reduce speed and make sure headlights are on to increase the visibility of your vehicle to those around you.
